page.title: 05INTERESTING PEOPLE
page.content: The school was heated by{coke stoves and sometimes the children warmed soup on them because they had to bring their own dinner to school. The{school bell}rang at 9 o'clock and if anyone was even one minute late they got the cane. They remembered one boy coming to school on a pony. The boys, girls and teachers all came in by different doors and no-one was allowed to use some-one elses entrance. The children were very keen on singing and Mrs. Bowman showed us photographs of herself in{singing {competitions}which Belsay often won. These were held in Morpeth. The boys grew vegetables which they gave to the villagers. One of the {vegetable gardens}was where we now have our mobile classroom.
